October 11-Sat. October 12, 2013 If you meet all of these prerequisites, please read on The PITT Pathfinders are student recruiters who work as employees of the Office of Admissions and Financial Aid. We participate in the recruitment of prospective students to the University by giving campus tours, attending on-and-off-campus recruitment programs and contacting prospective students by letter, phone and the Internet. We are dedicated to recruiting diverse and exceptional individuals and believe that PITT is a quality institution offering exciting opportunities for all students. The various programs and functions of Pathfinders allow us to serve an important role in helping prospective students through the college selection process. Participation in the Pathfinder organization requires a significant time commitment. Because of this commitment, Pathfinders is a paid position (work-study or student employment), as well as a student organization. A minimum dedication of five work hours per week and several all-day Friday and Saturday programs is expected of all Pathfinders, though it is possible to work more if desired. This application is the first step in our screening process. Given the high level of interest, we regret that we are unable to interview every applicant. For this reason, we ask that you take the time to complete this application as accurately and as thoroughly as possible. Following review of the applications, you will attend a mandatory Meet and Mingle on Sunday, September 15. After this event, you may be asked to attend a set of group interviews the week of September 23rd-September 27th. Please direct any questions to Kristen Kowalski, Director of Hiring, Training, and Recruitment, at PFHIRE pitt.edu. Thank you for your interest and best of luck in the hiring process!
